uk.ac.ebi.pride.jmztab.utils.errors

Class MZTabErrorList

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.pride.jmztab.utils.errors.MZTabErrorList

  • public class MZTabErrorList
extends Object
    A limit max capacity list, if contains a couple of MZTabError objects. If overflow, system will raise MZTabErrorOverflowException. Besides this, during add a new MZTabError object, it's MZTabErrorType.level SHOULD equal or great than its level setting.
    Since:
    29/01/13
    Author:
    qingwei

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MZTabErrorList()
      Generate a error list, which max size is MZTabProperties.MAX_ERROR_COUNT, and only allow MZTabErrorType.Level.Error or greater level errors to be added into list.
      MZTabErrorList(MZTabErrorType.Level level)
      Generate a error list, which max size is MZTabProperties.MAX_ERROR_COUNT
      MZTabErrorList(MZTabErrorType.Level level, int maxErrorCount)
      Generate a error list, with given error level and maximum error count.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MZTabErrorList

        public MZTabErrorList()
        Generate a error list, which max size is MZTabProperties.MAX_ERROR_COUNT, and only allow MZTabErrorType.Level.Error or greater level errors to be added into list.

      • MZTabErrorList

        public MZTabErrorList(MZTabErrorType.Level level)
        Generate a error list, which max size is MZTabProperties.MAX_ERROR_COUNT
        Parameters:
        level - if null, default level is MZTabErrorType.Level.Error

      • MZTabErrorList

        public MZTabErrorList(MZTabErrorType.Level level,
              int maxErrorCount)
        Generate a error list, with given error level and maximum error count.
        Parameters:
        level - if null, default level is MZTabErrorType.Level.Error
        maxErrorCount - the maximum number of errors recorded by this list before an MZTabErrorOverflowException is thrown

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorList

        public List<MZTabError> getErrorList()
        Unmodifiable list of errors
        Returns:
        error list

      • add

        public boolean add(MZTabError error)
            throws MZTabErrorOverflowException
        A limit max capacity list, if contains a couple of MZTabError objects. If overflow, system will raise MZTabErrorOverflowException. Besides this, during add a new MZTabError object, it's MZTabErrorType.level SHOULD equal or greater than its level setting.
        Parameters:
        error - SHOULD NOT set null
        Throws:
        MZTabErrorOverflowException

      • getMaxErrorCount

        public int getMaxErrorCount()
        Returns:
        The maximum number of errors that are going to be reported before the parser stops with an MZTabErrorOverflowException

      • setMaxErrorCount

        public void setMaxErrorCount(int maxErrorCount)
        Define the maximum number of errors recorded by this list before an MZTabErrorOverflowException is thrown
        Parameters:
        maxErrorCount - needs to be a positive number or zero will be set

      • getLevel

        public MZTabErrorType.Level getLevel()
        Returns:
        level of errors reported MZTabErrorType.level

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(MZTabErrorType.Level level)
        Define the level of the errors that are going to be store in the list. The incoming errors with an equal or highest level will be stored.
        Parameters:
        level - MZTabErrorType.level

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all errors stored in the error list.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of elements in this list.

      • getError

        public MZTabError getError(int index)
        Returns the element at the specified position in this list.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the element to return

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this list contains no elements.

      • print

        public void print(OutputStream out)
           throws IOException
        Print error list to output stream.
        Parameters:
        out - SHOULD NOT set null.
        Throws:
        IOException

        public String toString()
        Print error list to string.
